definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: The boatman nodded towards the north of the bay with some disdain.
sentences.chinese: 船老大略帶輕蔑神情朝海灣北部點了點頭。

sentences.english: The captain of Dad's boat refused to go any farther.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸座的船的船老大拒絕繼續前進。

sentences.english: Dad persuaded the captain of a pien-tzu to take them down the Han River to Hankow.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸說服一條“扁舟”的船老大帶他們順漢江去漢口。
老黃幾乎喊着“命令”船老大。

definition: person who lives and makes a living on a boat/boatman/boat dweller
(of a boat) to reach the shore/to pull toward shore/close to shore/landfall
fishing boat/same as 漁船|渔船
